definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: The additional complexity of an MVC application simply isn't warranted.
sentences.chinese: MVC應用法度額外的錯雜性則是無法包管的。

sentences.english: I let her wear my guardian angel pin to help keep her safe.
sentences.chinese: 我讓她戴上了我的保衛天神別針，來包管她的安定。

sentences.english: But, my dear, your father cannot spare the horses, I am sure.
sentences.chinese: 可是，乖孩子，我包管你爸爸勻不出拖車子的馬來。

sentences.english: Ensure a sufficient supply of all silverware, glassware and Chinaware for service.
sentences.chinese: 包管開餐時有充足的餐具，杯子和瓷器。

sentences.english: I can get you there in 15 minutes, traffic or no traffic.
sentences.chinese: 我15分鐘之內包管把你送到，不管交通阻塞不阻塞。

sentences.english: But, my dear, your father cannot spare the horses, I am sure.
sentences.chinese: 可是，乖孩子，我包管你爸爸勻不出拖車子的馬來。

sentences.english: It's something that would have, in old Europe, guaranteed you a duel.
sentences.chinese: 在古歐洲包管會挑起一場決鬥。

sentences.english: Can assure assuring cost effectiveness from this, shorten appear on the market time.
sentences.chinese: 由此能夠包管明施的本錢效益，並縮短上市時候。

sentences.english: Iassure you it wont happen again.
sentences.chinese: 我包管此類事情不會再發生。

sentences.english: We assure you of our best services at all times.
sentences.chinese: 我方包管向貴方隨時供給最好辦事。

sentences.english: It's definitely worth it to finish by the twentieth.
sentences.chinese: 爲包管20號前降成，那肯定是值得的。

definition: certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
let's talk about the unpleasant things first/let's be frank
pinyin: chou3 hua4 shuo1 zai4 qian2 tou5

definition: to create a disturbance/to make trouble/to harass
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
